snippet: Maj. Gen. Bennet Sacolick said that changes in the armed services had led to opening front-line combat positions to women.
abstract: Maj Gen Bennet Sacolick, director of force management for Special Operations Command, which trains elite Rangers, Green Berets and SEAL units, says today's military requires as much intellectual power as firepower, saying 'days of Rambo are over'; says changes have led to opening front-line combat positions for women.
lead_paragraph: Maj. Gen. Bennet Sacolick said that changes in the armed services had led to opening front-line combat positions to women.

headline.main: Less ‘Rambo’ Seen in New U.S. Military Culture
headline.print_headline: Less ‘Rambo’ Seen in New Military Culture

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces
keywords.name: subject
